title: Even as Egypt Hosts Climate Summit, Selling Fossil Fuels Is a Priority
description: Desperate for cash as the fallout from the Ukraine war batters its economy, Egypt has been conserving natural gas at home to sell to Europe.
dc:creator: Vivian Yee
media:description: Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission, second from left, with Tarek el-Molla, Egypt’s minister of petroleum, in June, after signing a deal for Egypt and Israel to export natural gas to Europe.
